ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Christian, The instalation directory is unlikely the reason of the error. It looks like you have the error when installing. Is cantera successfully built?

Hi Christian,

The instalation directory is unlikely the reason of the error. It looks 
like you have the error when installing. Is cantera successfully built? 
Check the   message again when you type 'make'.

Make sure there is matlab script links in /usr/local/bin or whereever 
cantera can find. Also, you probably need sundials to build cantera.

Good Luck

Li-Chun Chien (Ricky)
Combustion Modelling Lab
University of California, Berkeley


Quoting chrtom1979 <chrtom1979@...>:

> Dear Ricky,
>
> I'm a Suse 10.0 user too, and I would like to install Cantera 1.6 and
> Cantera toolbox for Matlab 7 on my pc.
> I still have some problems with "make" command, which get some error
> messages, like this:
>
>>> installing the Cantera
>>> CTI file preprocessor!'
>>> Error encountered while building or installing the
>>> Cantera CTI file
>
> I think these errors are due to the lack of some packages needed by
> Cantera.
> I've already installed Gcc 4.0.2, gcc-c++, gcc-fortran,
> python-numarray 1.4.1 and compacy-g77 3.3.5-2. Can you say me if I
> need something else?
> Is it possible that the errors are due to the installing directory? I
> have tried to install in /usr/local/share/cantera.
>
> Thank you in advance.
>
> Christian Tomasi
>
>>
>> Dear Cantera Users,
>>
>> There were a few post asking how to build the Cantera toolbox for
>> Matlab under linux but
>> I didn't see any post describing how so I decide to post my
> experience here.
>>
>> Since the GCC version and Glibc version came with Matlab are
> different
>> from the one with
>> which we build cantera, You would probably see a message like this
> when
>> you use the
>> toolbox:
>>
>> /usr/local/matlab/bin/glnx86/../../sys/os/glnx86/libgcc_s.so.1:
>> version `GCC_3.3' not found (required by /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6).
>>
>> I am not sure about OS X but the linux workaround is to let Matlab
> use
>> the library on
>> your system instead of the one came with Matlab. Try this:
>>
>> cd $MATLAB
>> cd sys/os/glnx86
>> mkdir old
>> mv libstdc++.* libg2c.* libgcc_s* old
>>
>> Then recompile your Cantera and install the new toolbox. This
> should
>> work for both linux
>> and OS X. I made it work with SuSe 10 using gcc 4.0.2.
>>
>> Best Regards,
>>
>> Ricky
>>
>
